Get started¶

Quickstart¶

The fastest way you can get started is by using the simplePlot module

there are two versions of Grafikrechner:

  • python 2.7

  • python 3.x

they are located under:

  • src/grafikrechner/python27

  • src/grafikrechner/python30

as per your use case copy either verion to your project directory, the syntax is the same

Get started¶

to get started import the the simplePlot module, since the plot module is in another directory firstly add the directory to your python path

import sys
sys.path.append("\\path\\to\\python30")
#or \\path\\to\\python27

now you can import the simplePlot module

from simplePlot import *

Simpleplot functions¶

Firstly initalize the simplePlot function by passsing height and width note, the centre will be at height/2,width/2 like a normal coordinate system

height = 500
width = 500

plot = simplePlot(height,width)

this will also automatically create a cache folder with a jsonStore.json file

You can pass function with lambda or like a normal function with def

#simple function with lambda
exampleFunction = lambda x: x+1

#normal def
def exampleFunction2(x):
    return x+1

You can use runFunction to run your labda or def function

#run the functions to get the x and y coordinates

#lambda
plot.runFunction(exampleFunction)
#def
plot.runFunction(exampleFunction2)

To get the plotted values use getFunction:

plot.getFunction("exampleFunction")
plot.getFunction("exampleFunction2")

saveName = "name_of_your_file"

You can save the output to your cache, it wil be saved as save + your file name

saveName = "exampleName"

plot.saveFunctions(saveName)

#to get the saved contents
#note make sure that the same python version is used
plot.readFromCache(saveName)
#file name: save_saveName.window27 or .window30

#to see which functions were plotted
plot.listFunctions()
